name: insensibly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that you cannot easily notice or feel: Clumps of trees merged insensibly into dense forest. The new meaning of the word seems to have emerged almost insensibly.
in a state where you cannot use your senses: The body was slumped insensibly across the table. After drinking three bottles of wine, he had become insensibly drunk.
More examplesFewer examplesDarwin believed that evolution proceeded slowly and insensibly.We found ourselves insensibly pulled into the dispute.After the incident, her behaviour towards her colleagues insensibly became more reserved.
